pages.text: This entry could be of use to those in pursuit of some modular tools, which might stem from the fact it's impossible to craft the ''usual'' stuff.$(br2)This entry does not contain any valuable information other than the starting necessities and example multiblock layouts. If you're wondering about metal tool parts or Steel, check out $(l)this entry/$!

All of the info about materials and modifiers is, as always, contained in the booklet titled ''$(4)$(o)Materials and You/$'', which also contains some flavor descriptions for Tinker's Construct and Complement multiblocks.
Before you start making your own tools, you will need a Stencil Table to draft some Patterns of the Tool Parts you want.
A Pattern Chest can hold large amounts of various Patterns and Casts, and can be placed next to a Part Builder for quick access.

After you've drafted out some Patterns, you need to use the Pattern Builder in order to shape your desired material into Tool Parts.
This should be obvious, but you can't shape metal Parts in this table.

When you have all of the Tool Parts you need, you can use the Tool Station to craft your own, modular tools.
And, if you don't know which Parts you need, this Station can give you some visual hints!

The Porcelain Melter is the first ''traditional'' Tinker's Construct-style fluid operator you can use to melt things into fluid counterparts, and cast the fluids onto things.
$(l)This will be necessary to perform Metalworking!
